--- In junit@yahoogro=
ups.com, "stefan.birkner" <mail@...> wrote:
>
> Hello,
> sometimes you care=
 about the order of rules. Therefore I created a RuleChain, which is a rule=
 itself:
> 
> @Rule
> public TestRule chain =3D RuleChain.outerRule(new Fir=
stRule()).enclose(new SecondRule());
> 
> What do you thing about the namin=
g outerRule and enclose?
> 
> What do you think about starting with the out=
er rule instead of starting with the inner rule:
> 
> @Rule
> public TestRu=
le chain =3D RuleChain.innerRule(new SecondRule()).enclosedBy(new FirstRule=
());
> 
> If you want to see the code, look at https://github.com/stefanbir=
kner/junit/commit/3584c44bedd8705f30dda4f4213fa45655b998c7
> The issue is h=
ttps://github.com/KentBeck/junit/issues/193
> 
> ciao,
> stefan
